page.title: 09School Playground Games.
page.content: When it is playtime I play 40-40 which is like Hide and Seek. One of us has to count somewhere where you can't peep (this is called the post). You have to count to 40. The other child- ren run to a hiding place. When the person has stopped counting he has to look for the others. If you are hiding you have to get back to the post without letting him see you. When you get back to the post you have to say 40-40 in. If the person who is on it sees you he tries to get back to the post first and he says 40-40 David (or whatever their name is). People who are caught have to stay by the post, but if the last person gets back to the post without being seen he can say 40-40 save-all and all the children who have been caught are saved and the same person has to be on it again. (Ben age 8.)
